revised_title: Arthur William Conway's Life and Scientific Contributions
tldr: Arthur William Conway was a distinguished Irish Catholic scientist of his generation, born in Wexford in 1875. He studied at St Peter's College and University College Dublin, where he earned First-Class Honours and later became a professor of Mathematical Physics. Conway's research focused on mathematical physics, quaternions, and the equations of the electromagnetic field. He collaborated with fellow scientist J.A. McClelland, and their work contributed to the recognition of University College Dublin's mathematical-physical school as one of high distinction.
